page.title: 05Mammals of New Deer
page.content: The fields, garden and buildings at {South Mains of Auchmaliddie}have a sizeable population of small mammals including the following species;{brown {rat, fieldmouse, woodmouse, bank vole, {shrew, mole, pipistrelle bat and {rabbit. In recent years there has been a reduction in the number of{hares but they can still be seen reasonably regularly.{Stoat}(sometimes seen in ermine) and{weasel} are not uncommon and there is quite a large{fox population. Individual foxes are regular visitors to the garden at night and groups can be seen in the fields in daylight. In the spruce plantation lower down the hill at Mitchellhill there is a group of{roe deer}that are often seen in the fields.This is where the foxes have their den.
